sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Outbound Network Connection Initiated By Script Interpreter
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects a script interpreter wscript/cscript opening a network connection to a non-local network. Adversaries may use script to download malicious payloads.

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: PSScriptPolicyTest Creation By Uncommon Process
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects the creation of the "PSScriptPolicyTest" PowerShell script by an uncommon process. This file is usually generated by Microsoft Powershell to test against Applocker.

match_context.values: @{TargetFilename=%USERPROFILE%\AppData\Local\Temp\__PSScriptPolicyTest_bvgh2rtb.ux5.ps1}
@{TargetFilename=%USERPROFILE%\AppData\Local\Temp\__PSScriptPolicyTest_cm34butk.bm0.psm1}

@{TargetFilename=%USERPROFILE%\AppData\Local\Temp\__PSScriptPolicyTest_g1yc5ynu.oax.psm1}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Non Interactive PowerShell Process Spawned
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects non-interactive PowerShell activity by looking at the "powershell" process with a non-user GUI process such as "explorer.exe" as a parent.

attributes.magic: PE32 executable (GUI) Intel 80386, for MS Windows

threat_severity.level_description: Severity HIGH because it was considered trojan. Other contributing factor was that it could not be run in sandboxes.
